Balancing Robot

Balancing Robot folowing a tenis ball

About the project

The project was carried out in a group of 3 people as part of the team project classes in engineering studies. The goal of the project was to create a balancing robot that would follow the tennis ball. Reaching the target was supposed to be indicated by a sound signal, and it was to be able to be remotely controlled by a mobile application. We wanted to stabilize the robot on two wheels by using accelerometers and gyros to control the engines (PID). Image recognition was mainly my task. I managed to realize them by implementing a neural network from prepared samples. The problem was the influence of external lights, but I managed to recognize the ball in real time, however, we could not achieve stabilization of the robot on 2 wheels, so we limited its functionality to locate the ball and drive up to it, and to remote control of the robot through bluetooth and a mobile application.

The first version of the robot's mechanical design

This is the first version of the robot that was supposed to be stable on two wheels, but due to the used engines, we were unable to achieve stabilization.

3D model of the designed robot controller

PCB for sensor data collection and motor control. The board was also connected to a Raspberry Pi to control the robot in the direction of the ball.
